DOC.brief_title: Comparison Between Main Branch Side Branch Vessels
DOC.detailed_description: 1 . Clinical significance EKG change , pain score 1 min balloon occlusion 2 . Different characteristic ST segment elevation v non-elevation side branch 3 . Comparison coronary wedge pressure 4 . Establishing new score system predict ST elevation 1min balloon occlusion
DOC.criteria: Age ≥ 18 Able verbally confirm understandings risk , benefit receive percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) true bifurcation lesion , he/she his/her legally authorize representative provide write informed consent prior study related procedure Significant stenosis bifurcation lesion ( > 50 % visual estimate ) always include stenosis side branch ( true bifurcation ) Target main branch lesion ( ) locate native coronary artery diameter ≥ 2.5 mm ≤ 4.5 mm . Target side branch lesion ( ) native coronary artery diameter ≥ 2.25 mm Target lesion ( ) amenable PCI final kissing balloon angioplasty side branch Noncardiac comorbid condition present life expectancy < 1 year may result protocol noncompliance ( per site investigator 's medical judgment ) Patients refuse give informed consent Patients leave main coronary artery stenosis Patients total occlusion bifurcation lesion Patients infarctrelated artery lesion interest Patients leave ventricular ejection fraction < 40 % Patients primary cardiomyopathy Patients chronic kidney disease define serum Cr > 2.0 Patients severe side effect contraindication adenosine
